content.description: Climb up the rotten rock 20 feet to the roof crack.  Turn the roof in a flaring offwidth and continue in it 30-40 more feet to the top out.  Good rock from the roof, onwards.
content.protection: Gear to the big stuff.  Rap at the station to the right.
content.location: At the right end of the Coup D'etat Wall, this is the first overhanging crack left of the rap station.  Start almost right below it.

content.description: Climb the face/crack on decent rock 20 feet to gain the roof.  Pull the roof and continue in the dihedral crack angling up and right for another 30 feet or so to the anchors.  Good rock after the start.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5".  2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Near the right end of the Coup D'etat Wall.  This is the second obvious line left of the rap station.  Start under the roof and large right angling dihedral crack above.

content.description: This route is more commonly used as a quick approach to the West and East Main Bluffs as well as the Throne climbing areas.  Start by gaining the ledge then begin the low angled easy slab that is quite run out. The first piece of pro can be placed just before the crux where the route goes vertical. Pull a few moves to gain a set of tiered ledges and the clip the chains.  You can then top out and enjoy a 3-5 minute easy hike back to the parking lot if you want to avoid the steeper, longer dog walk approach.
content.location: This route is at the point that separates the West and East Main Bluffs.  It is easy to identify because it looks like a ramp.  It is also near the junction of trail that splits off to head to The Throne area.

content.description: Start in the same corner as Pumpy Love(left of Battle of the Bulge), then at the horizontal break, traverse a handcrack left to the large red fin.  Pull through the bulge here on seams(pro and technical crux) and up the beautiful plated face.
content.protection: To 3"- small nuts at the crux. Rap from tree.

content.description: Sweet pitch of face climbing. Pass through a slightly sandy, gray start, and pull in to a "sea of perfect crimps". Traverse left and then head up straight through the crux. Beautiful rock and sustained movement on dreamy crimps and precise feet.
content.location: Bolt line right of Coup D'etat (Shares anchors).

content.description: A single locker is useful to clip the 1st bolt.  A powerful sustained section of climbing leads to the 2nd bolt.  After clipping it, enjoy one of the coolest faces at Sam's.  Remeber to angle up and left after the last bolt.  This route is considered height dependent and opinions of difficuly range from 11a through 11d.  At 5'9", I think 11c.
content.protection: 4 bolts, slings for chickenheads, 2 bolt rap anchor.
content.location: This is the line up the long, steep orange face between 2 dihedrals.

climbs.name: Little Sheba
climbs.fa: Tony Mayse,Todd Johnson, Joe Romero Nov.2012

content.description: The crux is at the start and continues up past the 2nd bolt. Consider stick clipping the second bolt. Pumpy route from the start and does not let up for a ways.   (The route was put up on lead).
content.protection: 5 Bolts and sling for the chicken head after the fifth bolt. Shares anchors with Ode to a..
content.location: Located fifteen feet to the left of Ode to a Portly Man.

content.description: Climb up an easy dirty section to reach the acute left-leaning crack with a small roof move. After squirming up and over the ledge run it out to the top.

Climb the slabby face and dihedral to the point where the dihedral crack becomes a chimney.  There, 1. climb the left side of the chimney to gain the clifftop, or 2. go right on the face to top out.  I prefer option 1.  Good rock.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5".  Rap off trees or hike to the rap near the Chickenhead Wall or Diet Pepsi.
content.location: Near the middle of the Coup D'etat Wall, 80-100 feet right of Battle of the Bulge.  An orange face (Ode to a Portly Man) is framed by a dihedral crack on each side of it.  This is the dihedral crack on the right.

content.description: The namesake of the wall, this line follows a bouldery start to a thin seam. The crux comes low but you''ll still have fun fighting the pump while placing mostly small pro above.
content.protection: gear to 3", bring the small stuff
content.location: Immediately right of Battle of the Bulge on Coup D'etat wall.

content.description:
Climb 15 feet up to the overhanging hand and fist crack.  Follow it up and over the bulge, ending up on a slab.  Climb the chickenhead covered slab up and right to the overhanging handcrack.  Pull this roof and anchor on the tree directly above. 

  There are two other options for topping out to keep this climb at 5.9+.  At the slab, either go around the roof to the right(5.8) or traverse left to top out(5.6).  These alternatives avoid some great moves, though.
content.protection: Standard rack plus offwidth gear.  No small stuff necessary.  Anchor at trees.  Best descent is to top out and hike to the Ramp descent near the Chickenhead Wall.
content.location: Located near the right end of the West Main Bluff, this is the first line right around the corner from Fat City.  It is a large overhanging offwidth that slants right.

content.description: Climb the chimney, wide crack on decent rock to the roof.  Pull through the roof 20 feet up via the fist crack and continue on the slightly slabby dihedral to the anchors.  Good rock starting in the roof.
content.protection: Pro to 4" or more.  Rap off bolted anchors
content.location: At the left end of the Coup D'etat Wall, this is the large crack in the dihedral.  Start in the wide crack below the roof.

content.description: Mostly cracks, a few stellar faces, though.
